data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كَانُوا comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word الْعَذَابِ comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: To gain, acquire, seek after, gather (riches), do, commit, earn.
data.sentence: The word يَكْسِبُونَ comes from the root ك س ب and is associated with the meanings: To gain, acquire, seek after, gather (riches), do, commit, earn.

data.meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
data.sentence: The word الْهُدَى comes from the root ه د ي and is associated with the meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.

data.meanings: to be light, vile, owe, despicable, quiet, become weak, gentle, contemptible, base. hawwana - to facilitate, despise, condemn. ahaana - to despise, scorn.
data.sentence: The word الْهُونِ comes from the root ه و ن and is associated with the meanings: to be light, vile, owe, despicable, quiet, become weak, gentle, contemptible, base. hawwana - to facilitate, despise, condemn. ahaana - to despise, scorn.

data.meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
data.sentence: The word فَهَدَيْنَاهُمْ comes from the root ه د ي and is associated with the meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
The word فَاسْتَحَبُّوا comes from the root ح ب ب and is associated with the meanings: To love, like, wish.

data.meanings: to swerve from duty, stray from the right course, be or become blind, ignorant, obscure and dubious, deprive of the sight, rend abstruse, blind, dark, conceal. amaha - mental blindness, amaya - mental and physical blindness.
data.sentence: The word الْعَمَى comes from the root ع م ي and is associated with the meanings: to swerve from duty, stray from the right course, be or become blind, ignorant, obscure and dubious, deprive of the sight, rend abstruse, blind, dark, conceal. amaha - mental blindness, amaya - mental and physical blindness.
The word فَأَخَذَتْهُمْ comes from the root ا خ ذ and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to smite or strike (lightning, thunderbolt), swoon, become unconscious, be stunned, faint.. sa'iqun - one in a swoon.. saAAiqat  (pl. sawaAAiq) - stunning noise as of a thunderbolt, vehement cry, thunderbolt, thunderclap, destructive calamity, death, noise.
data.sentence: The word صَاعِقَةُ comes from the root ص ع ق and is associated with the meanings: to smite or strike (lightning, thunderbolt), swoon, become unconscious, be stunned, faint.. sa'iqun - one in a swoon.. saAAiqat  (pl. sawaAAiq) - stunning noise as of a thunderbolt, vehement cry, thunderbolt, thunderclap, destructive calamity, death, noise.
